text_b: 1. Introduction to the Foundation Level Extensions'

text_a: 1. Introduction to the Foundation Level Extensions'
text_b: This overview document is intended for anyone with an interest in the ISTQB Foundation Level'

text_a: This overview document is intended for anyone with an interest in the ISTQB Foundation Level'
text_b: Extensions who wants a high-level introduction to the leading principles and an overview of the individual'

text_a: Extensions who wants a high-level introduction to the leading principles and an overview of the individual'
text_b: extension syllabi.'

text_a: extension syllabi.'
text_b: From time to time, ISTQB will update this document to reflect any additional extensions that shall be'

text_a: From time to time, ISTQB will update this document to reflect any additional extensions that shall be'
text_b: introduced for the Foundation Level, or to reflect major changes in existing ones. Publications of the'

text_a: introduced for the Foundation Level, or to reflect major changes in existing ones. Publications of the'
text_b: updated document will be available on the ISTQB website.'

text_a: updated document will be available on the ISTQB website.'
text_b: The ISTQB Foundation and Advanced Level syllabi have been defined and have been on the market for'

text_a: The ISTQB Foundation and Advanced Level syllabi have been defined and have been on the market for'
text_b: some time. New topics emerge due to technology and methodology changes in the market which often'

text_a: some time. New topics emerge due to technology and methodology changes in the market which often'
text_b: are brought into the ISTQB program as new Expert Level syllabi. However, not all topics are suited for the'

text_a: are brought into the ISTQB program as new Expert Level syllabi. However, not all topics are suited for the'
text_b: Expert Level. For this reason, the extension syllabi are established at the Foundation Level to expand the'

text_a: Expert Level. For this reason, the extension syllabi are established at the Foundation Level to expand the'
text_b: ISTQB program to incorporate new or updated knowledge. New extensions shall be discussed and'

text_a: ISTQB program to incorporate new or updated knowledge. New extensions shall be discussed and'
text_b: introduced by the ISTQB periodically. Extensions may be established at the Advanced Level as well, but'

text_a: introduced by the ISTQB periodically. Extensions may be established at the Advanced Level as well, but'
text_b: that is beyond the scope of this document.'

text_a: that is beyond the scope of this document.'

text_a: The following Foundation Level Extension syllabus has been released:'

text_b: 2. Introduction to Foundation Level Agile Tester Extension'

text_a: 2. Introduction to Foundation Level Agile Tester Extension'
text_b: The certification for Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester is designed for professionals who are'

text_a: The certification for Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester is designed for professionals who are'
text_b: working within Agile environments. It is also for professionals who are planning to start implementing'

text_a: working within Agile environments. It is also for professionals who are planning to start implementing'
text_b: Agile methods in the near future, or are working within companies that plan to do so, The certification'

text_a: Agile methods in the near future, or are working within companies that plan to do so, The certification'
text_b: provides an advantage for those who would like to know the required Agile activities, roles, methods, and'

text_a: provides an advantage for those who would like to know the required Agile activities, roles, methods, and'
text_b: methodologies specific to their role.'

text_a: methodologies specific to their role.'
text_b: 2.1 Intended Audience'

text_a: 2.1 Intended Audience'
text_b: The Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester qualification is aimed at four main groups of professionals:'

text_a: The Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester qualification is aimed at four main groups of professionals:'
text_b: 1. Professionals who have achieved in-depth testing experience in traditional methods and would'

text_a: 1. Professionals who have achieved in-depth testing experience in traditional methods and would'
text_b: like to get an Agile Tester Certificate.'

text_a: like to get an Agile Tester Certificate.'
text_b: 2. Junior professional testers who are just starting in the testing profession, have received the'

text_a: 2. Junior professional testers who are just starting in the testing profession, have received the'
text_b: Foundation Level certificate, and would like to know more about the tester’s role in an Agile'

text_a: Foundation Level certificate, and would like to know more about the tester’s role in an Agile'
text_b: environment.'

text_a: environment.'
text_b: 3. Professionals who are relatively new to testing and are required to implement test approaches,'

text_a: 3. Professionals who are relatively new to testing and are required to implement test approaches,'
text_b: methods and techniques in their day to day job in Agile projects.'

text_a: methods and techniques in their day to day job in Agile projects.'
text_b: 4. Professionals who are experienced in their role including unit testing and need more'

text_a: 4. Professionals who are experienced in their role including unit testing and need more'
text_b: understanding and knowledge about how to perform and manage testing on all levels in Agile'

text_a: understanding and knowledge about how to perform and manage testing on all levels in Agile'
text_b: projects.'

text_a: projects.'
text_b: These professionals include people who are in roles such as testers, test analysts, test engineers, test'

text_a: These professionals include people who are in roles such as testers, test analysts, test engineers, test'
text_b: consultants, test managers, user acceptance testers, and software developers.'

text_a: consultants, test managers, user acceptance testers, and software developers.'
text_b: This Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester certification may also be appropriate for anyone who'

text_a: This Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester certification may also be appropriate for anyone who'
text_b: wants a deeper understanding of software testing in the Agile world, such as project managers, quality'

text_a: wants a deeper understanding of software testing in the Agile world, such as project managers, quality'
text_b: managers, software development managers, business analysts, IT directors, and management'

text_a: managers, software development managers, business analysts, IT directors, and management'
text_b: consultants.'

text_a: consultants.'
text_b: 2.2 Career Paths for Testers'

text_a: 2.2 Career Paths for Testers'
text_b: Building on the Foundation Level, the Agile Tester Extension supports the definition of career paths for'

text_a: Building on the Foundation Level, the Agile Tester Extension supports the definition of career paths for'
text_b: professional testers. A person with the Agile Tester certificate has extended the broad understanding of'

text_a: professional testers. A person with the Agile Tester certificate has extended the broad understanding of'
text_b: testing acquired at the Foundation Level to enable him or her to work effectively as a professional tester in'

text_a: testing acquired at the Foundation Level to enable him or her to work effectively as a professional tester in'
text_b: an Agile project.'

text_a: an Agile project.'
text_b: People possessing an ISTQB Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester certificate may use the Certified'

text_a: People possessing an ISTQB Foundation Level Extension – Agile Tester certificate may use the Certified'
text_b: Tester Foundation Level acronym CTFL-AT.'

text_a: Tester Foundation Level acronym CTFL-AT.'
text_b: 2.3 Learning Objectives'

text_a: 2.3 Learning Objectives'
text_b: In general, the Foundation Level syllabus is examinable at a K1 level, i.e., the candidate will recognize,'

text_a: In general, the Foundation Level syllabus is examinable at a K1 level, i.e., the candidate will recognize,'
text_b: remember and recall terms and concepts stated in the Foundation Level syllabus.'

text_a: remember and recall terms and concepts stated in the Foundation Level syllabus.'
text_b: In addition, all Foundation Level syllabus learning objectives are examinable at the same K- level in an'

text_a: In addition, all Foundation Level syllabus learning objectives are examinable at the same K- level in an'
text_b: extension exam.'

text_a: extension exam.'

text_b: 2.6 Keeping It Current'

text_a: 2.6 Keeping It Current'

text_b: 3.1 Business Outcomes'

text_a: 3.1 Business Outcomes'
text_b: This section lists the Business Outcomes expected of a candidate who has achieved the Foundation Level'

text_a: This section lists the Business Outcomes expected of a candidate who has achieved the Foundation Level'
text_b: Extension – Agile Tester certification.'

text_a: Extension – Agile Tester certification.'
text_b: An Agile Tester can…'

text_a: An Agile Tester can…'
text_b: AFM1 Collaborate in a cross-functional Agile team being familiar with principles and basic'

text_a: AFM1 Collaborate in a cross-functional Agile team being familiar with principles and basic'
text_b: practices of Agile software development.'

text_a: practices of Agile software development.'
text_b: AFM2 Adapt existing testing experience and knowledge to Agile values and principles.'

text_a: AFM2 Adapt existing testing experience and knowledge to Agile values and principles.'
text_b: AFM3 Support the Agile team in planning test-related activities.'

text_a: AFM3 Support the Agile team in planning test-related activities.'
text_b: AFM4 Apply relevant methods and techniques for testing in an Agile project.'

text_a: AFM4 Apply relevant methods and techniques for testing in an Agile project.'
text_b: AFM5 Assist the Agile team in test automation activities.'

text_a: AFM5 Assist the Agile team in test automation activities.'
text_b: AFM6 Assist business stakeholders in defining understandable and testable user stories,'

text_a: AFM6 Assist business stakeholders in defining understandable and testable user stories,'
text_b: scenarios, requirements and acceptance criteria as appropriate.'

text_a: scenarios, requirements and acceptance criteria as appropriate.'
text_b: AFM7 Work and share information with other team members using effective communication'

text_a: AFM7 Work and share information with other team members using effective communication'
text_b: styles and channels.'

text_a: styles and channels.'
text_b: In general, a Certified Tester Foundation Level – Agile Tester is expected to have acquired the necessary'

text_a: In general, a Certified Tester Foundation Level – Agile Tester is expected to have acquired the necessary'
text_b: skills to working effectively within an Agile team and environment.'

text_a: skills to working effectively within an Agile team and environment.'
text_b: 3.2 Content'

text_a: 3.2 Content'
text_b: Chapter 1: Agile Software Development'

text_a: Chapter 1: Agile Software Development'
text_b: The tester should remember the basic concept of Agile software development based on the Agile'

text_a: The tester should remember the basic concept of Agile software development based on the Agile'
text_b: Manifesto.'

text_a: Manifesto.'
text_b: The tester should understand the advantages of the whole-team approach and the benefits of'

text_a: The tester should understand the advantages of the whole-team approach and the benefits of'
text_b: early and frequent feedback.'

text_a: early and frequent feedback.'
text_b: The tester should recall Agile software development approaches.'

text_a: The tester should recall Agile software development approaches.'
text_b: The tester should be able to write testable user stories in collaboration with developers and'

text_a: The tester should be able to write testable user stories in collaboration with developers and'
text_b: business representatives.'

text_a: business representatives.'
text_b: The tester should understand how retrospectives can be used as a mechanism for process'

text_a: The tester should understand how retrospectives can be used as a mechanism for process'
text_b: improvement in Agile projects.'

text_a: improvement in Agile projects.'
text_b: The tester should understand the use and purpose of continuous integration.'

text_a: The tester should understand the use and purpose of continuous integration.'
text_b: The tester should know the differences between iteration and release planning, and how a tester'

text_a: The tester should know the differences between iteration and release planning, and how a tester'
text_b: adds value in each of these activities.'

text_a: adds value in each of these activities.'

text_b: Chapter 2: Fundamental Agile Testing Principles, Practices, and Processes'

text_a: Chapter 2: Fundamental Agile Testing Principles, Practices, and Processes'
text_b: The tester should be able to describe the differences between testing activities in Agile projects'

text_a: The tester should be able to describe the differences between testing activities in Agile projects'
text_b: and non-Agile projects.'

text_a: and non-Agile projects.'
text_b: The tester should be able to describe how development and testing activities are integrated in'

text_a: The tester should be able to describe how development and testing activities are integrated in'
text_b: Agile projects.'

text_a: Agile projects.'
text_b: The tester should be able to describe the role of independent testing in Agile projects.'

text_a: The tester should be able to describe the role of independent testing in Agile projects.'
text_b: The tester should be able to describe the tools and techniques used to communicate the status of'

text_a: The tester should be able to describe the tools and techniques used to communicate the status of'
text_b: testing in an Agile project, including test progress and product quality.'

text_a: testing in an Agile project, including test progress and product quality.'
text_b: The tester should be able to describe the process of evolving tests across multiple iterations and'

text_a: The tester should be able to describe the process of evolving tests across multiple iterations and'
text_b: explain why test automation is important to manage regression risk in Agile projects.'

text_a: explain why test automation is important to manage regression risk in Agile projects.'
text_b: The tester should understand the skills people, domain, and testing of a tester in an Agile team.'
